Reviews.Title: “DON'T ever stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaJordan
Reviews.Content: Needed one night to stay in Miami before I left for a cruise! I contacted an on-line agent on a travel site. Requested a clean and safe place to stay not to expensive... Well I guess my standards of safe and clean are way higher then the rep!!... The instant I walked in the smell of smoke hits you like a brick wall. I didn't even put my luggage on the floor, I also put towels all over the floor cause I didn't want to step. The neighborhood was loud and sketchy... didn't sleep all night, couldn't leave it was late and all the near hotels were full...It was a horrible start to my vaca!! Stay away at all cost!

Reviews.Title: “Terribly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Simon R
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay here for an 8 day visit to accompany a friend who had to go to Miami for medical reasons. It is no better than a regular hotel as far as facilities are concerned. Nothing to cook with no utensils, plates or such. No point in having the kitchen. Their web site is distinctly misleading. The girl in the office simply told me there was nothing she could do. After one night I need to find a new place to stay as this place sucks.

Reviews.Title: “LOUD!”
Reviews.Author: 58sandy53
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, Friday and Saturday while working in Miami. Got very little sleep because the street noise was so loud. It felt like a window was open with the boom, boom, boom, to the trucks zooming by. We had a nonsmoking room but next door was a smoking room. Of course we could smell it through the vents. When will they make whole floors nonsmoking? Will not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Basic and poor maintenance”
Reviews.Author: Manuel P
Reviews.Content: The place is an affordable option for an extended stay, however quality is low. Furniture and appliances are very basic and if you plan to cook there is only one multiuse pot, don’t expect a complete cookware set. It looks like is designed only to cook pasta ;-) a pot and a strainer If you are looking for privacy, this is not the place; the rooms are designed with only one window that looks to the hotel aisle, so any pedestrian will look inside your room. Staff is very kind. No amenities and TV channels options are just the basic ones

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: SiddMoras
Reviews.Content: Decent place. Nothing fancy. The receptionist was quite helpful on Day 1. I unfortunately had a bad experience but it was probably an abberration. The fire alarm kept going for half an hour at night before being fixed. Then the power was out for the night which was terrible (But it appears that the power was out in the whole town). I couldn't sleep at all. I dont know if I should be entitled to some refund but I left it at that.

Reviews.Title: “Having a Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ShayTay
Reviews.Content: I was a bit concerned about booking a month-long stay here when I read some of the previous reviews. However, now that I'm here, I can say that my worries were unfounded. The front desk staff have been friendly and helpful. The room is as expected in an extended stay property, and is clean and in good shape. I have a non-smoking room, but noticed a cigarette smell in the bathroom. The smell seemed to be coming from an unused vent in the ceiling, so I covered it and the smell stopped. The cable has a good selection of stations, including Fox and ABC, which a previous reviewer said they didn't have. I needed extra hangers and a staff member was kind enough to deliver an extra dozen immediately to my room. They have high-speed WIFI for a small one-time fee and I've had no problems with it. Although some reviewers have complained about the noise from planes coming into Miami Airport, not many actually fly above the hotel. If you have on the AC/heating unit, you rarely hear anything from outside the room. I'm in a second-floor room away from 87th Ave, a busy street, so I don't get any street noise. There is street construction going on in front of the hotel and the trucks stage next to it, so there is some noise from those trucks, but not usually before 7am. I love having the park next door! It's easily accessed from the hotel and provides a nice place to walk in the mornings, with a 1-mile paved path around a small lake. There are a few restaurants within walking distance, but you have to stay on the west side of 87th, as there are no crosswalks for some distance in either direction of the hotel. Tony Roma's is next door, Mondongo's a half-block away, and a strip center with Dunkin' Donuts, Quizno's, etc. is on the other side of the park. There are quite a few eateries up and down 87th, as well.

Reviews.Title: “I loved my homestead experience”
Reviews.Author: nappyhappy
Reviews.Content: I had planned to stay at Homestead - Blue Lagoon, but accidently booked Homestead Doral. The property was extremely clean and inviting. The checkin and checkout process was fast and efficient. My friend and I both commented on the pleasant scent that greeted us when we opened the door to the room. The property is close to the highway and I expected some noise but it was really quiet (I slept with the ac unit off). I missed the convenience of having a pantry on site, but the Tony Romas restuarant next door was a welcomed bonus. I have also stayed in Homestead - Ft. Lauderdale and Homestead - Blue Lagoon and I have enjoyed all of my experiences. This is definitely my hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, boring location”
Reviews.Author: Farcin
Reviews.Content: We only needed a night before our flight out of Miami and for that purpose this place is perfect. Rooms are nice, clean and spacious. We had an amazing deal on the room. Downside is location. You are far away from everything interesting. If you are looking for a cheap and safe place to crash i Miami this is your best pick for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware”
Reviews.Author: SeattleCat
Reviews.Content: This was hotel #2 of my extended business stay. After the location of my first hotel, I was pleasantly surprised by the exterior and location. It is right next to a park, with a path for running. It is also a 10 minute walk from USSOUTHCOM, and there is a Tony Roma's right across the street. The check in person was rude and harried. Wasn't very impressed. The front desk is only open from 7am until 11pm, so good luck if you get locked out. The room was basic, no extra amenities. Even though it has a kitchenette, they provide one pot, limited utensils, plates, and cups. The cleanliness of the place was dubious...I went out and bought a bottle of Clorox spray. Taking a shower, the tub was clogged, so I would be standing in 3 inches of water. The bed was hard and the linens old, with a dirty bedspread and gross velux blanket. Very few TV channels; while it had Showtime, it didn't have basics such as FOX or ABC. The other people that inhabited the building were not people that I would keep company with. While I requested (and got) a non-smoking room, people would smoke out in the balconies. They were loud, blaring music and fighting at all hours of the night. One of the key things to remember at this place (and other hotels in the Extended Stay chain) cuts costs by having your room cleaned once a week. If you need it cleaned outside of your one time, it's a fee of at least $10. This hotel is also right near the landing path of the airport, so the noise from the planes is considerable, but not unbearable. There was no fitness center onsite, but you could get free passes to the Bally's that was about 2 miles away.

Reviews.Title: “a lot of noise from airplanes and cars”
Reviews.Author: lamakacha
Reviews.Content: this hotel is right under the path of the airplanes coming and going to Miami Intern. Airport. Every single plane is a LOT of noise. It's a never stopping noise. Terrible!!! And not only the planes. Small trucks and big trucks too. Looks like it's a popular place for these trucks. They come any time of day, and of course with a noise. Another ugly thing: there is a field across from the hotel, where a really big and ugly trucks can park. This particular truck made a lot and a lot of noise early in the morning, and also produced huge huge fumes warming up the engine. The window in our room we kept open all the time, so the fumes filled our room...UGLY! Saturday, around 2am, a big family came, carrying a lot of luggage and making a lot of noise. Their room was right beside ours. So, we couldn't sleep for at least two hours, because they went somewhere and came back in 20 minutes with more luggage. The hotel is like a motel - two floors. If you're on the first floor, then you're a victim of some people on the phone who decide to speak outside for an hour, and you have to listen to everything they talk...very very annoying. Advise: if you like to be in quite, to really enjoy and rest, this is the last place to be. For families, it maybe ok. For business and just for relaxation - BIG NO NO ! On the other hand, room cleaning is Mondays for those who stay more than 3 nights. The service is very good. The place is clean, looks beautiful. It's possible to relax and rest, only at the certain times, when there are no flights. And the flights are as usual 4 times a day: 6am-8am, 12pm-2pm, 4pm-7pm, 11pm-12am. So, at these times expect noise noise and more noise.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again for business only.”
Reviews.Author: Bonita_Morenita
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel and my stay started off as a nightmare but ended well. I wound up staying here about a week. The night deskman was extremely rude and also would not give me a non-smoking room. He claimed there was nothing else available. There were also other guests at the front complaining of their smoking rooms when I checked in, but I thought it couldnt be that bad. When I got to the room, it smelled like the inside of an ashtray, the smoke smell was so strong I went to Walgreens at night after traveling all day just to buy Lysol and a Glade Plug In. After hours of trying to get settled in and sleep, this did not work. I called the front desk and requested another room, they still claimed nothing was available. At 3am my eyes were red and nose runny and throat itchy!!!! I had to call the front desk and threaten that I would have my CC company remove the charges because I literally couldn't breath or sleep and I would have to relocate to another hotel. I have had to stay in other smoking rooms before but this one was EXTREMELY bad. Not even opening the windows helped. I went to the front desk to get the keys for another room (suddenly there was availability), and the night deskman attempted to scold me like a child on how when I make a reservation I need to reserve a non-smoking room in advance. I was in disbelief!!! He was neither apologetic or even decent. He was upset that I had interrupted him at 3AM. I was the one moving my things in the middle of the night to the other side of the hotel with red eyes and a runny nose. This was the worse customer service I have ever received at a hotel in my life, and I'm a frequent business traveler. I would expect more from one of those "charge by the hour" roach motels. Needless to say, after that night I made it so I never had to go to the desk at night, and the women that were at the desk in the morning were extremely nice and helpful in every way possible. Also, the room that I was moved to was very decent and clean with a separate bedroom/living room. It had one of those motel smells, but this was a million times better than the previous room I had. The pool was small and very nice, especially in comparison to the hotel next door. There was hardly anyone at the pool. Next door there is a Sleep Inn and the pool was always full of families all day and night. There is also a BBQ grill at the pool with tables where you can cook and eat. The workout room was too warm and closet sized with only 2 machines. Luckily, I ran at the park down the street instead. Behind the hotel, about a block away, there is a very nice neighborhood park with lots of runners, golfers, bikers. It's surprising because you can't see any of this from the street, it all seems industrial and a bit ghetto looking from the main road, but if you walk down the street there are nice houses. The breakfast was comical. EVERYTHING was frozen and I would get to breakfast when it was ending everyday and the items were still frozen around 9am. There were frozen pancakes, english muffins, bagles, and bread etc., all hard as a rock. There was a toaster, but you had to microwave the breads before toasting them LOL. They literally had ice frozen on top of them as if they'd been in the freezer for weeks/months. There were 3 choices for cold cereal, and as I recall no fruit because I don't remember ever eating any and that would normally be my breakfast choice. There was orange juice and I believe apple juice also. Also microwave oatmeal. It was laughable, but at least they had something I guess. There were restaurants in the immediate area such as McDonalds, Taco Bell, a dine-in Pizza hut with salad bar(walking distance) and an IHOP (walking distance). I would only recommend this hotel for business travelers or people trying to save money with a family. I got an amazing deal on Priceline for this hotel. I would definitely stay here again but only at a severely discounted rate. Also, again, the desk manager on the night of my check-in, should not be in the hospitatlity business, PERIOD. I felt like I was being punk'd.

Reviews.Title: “Would have stayed elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Viaggio3
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit and stay in similarly priced hotels, however, there was a lot to be desired at this hotel. There were numerous little things that made it seem that the hotel was content operating at the mediocrity. Room smelled, had to ask for shampoo, no cups in room, iron was broken and leaked water all over my clothes, room was never cleaned and the hot water was lukewarm at best. The hotel serves its purpose and if you are struggling to find a place to stay it will do. I will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you're desperate!”
Reviews.Author: SWINGLINE34
Reviews.Content: I had originally reserved a room at another hotel (AmeriSuites Miami/Airport West) but that hotel transferred my reservation to this hotel because they "were going to be doing some construction". It just so happened that this was the same dates of the big Miami Boat Show Convention and I suspect they wanted to boot me because I was getting a discounted rate. Back to the Homestead. This place is not your average hotel. This hotel is substandard! They did have an airport shuttle but the driver couldn't speak english and I thought the old van they picked me up in wouldn't make it back to the hotel in one piece. The batteries in the tv remote were dead and corroding in the remote. The shelf in the closet was falling out of the wall. The place was noisy with the other residents blasting music in the parking lot from their car stereos. At night, some of the other residents were still blasting latino music from their room after 11pm. I called the front desk to complain and an answering machine answered and advised that the front desk was closed for the night. Apparently it's not manned overnight. It did give me the option of pushing 1 to be transferred to a person. I did so and the person who answered advised that no personnel was on site overnight. She said that if I could tell her which room the music was coming from, she'd call them by telephone and ask them to turn it down. I calmly explained to her that I was in bed for the night, not dressed, and wasn't going to walk the hotel to find out which room it was. Keep in mind this is an open air hotel where your room door opens to the outside parking lot. Not the safest of all the set-ups. Don't let your women stay here alone! This place was liveable but sub-standard for a hotel. Look elsewhere for a hotel unless you have no choice.

Reviews.Title: “One star”
Reviews.Author: endlessnameless
Reviews.Content: Thought I got a good deal on Priceline on a hotel near Miami airport for a 1-night pre-cruise stay. But this hotel is a $30 cab ride from the airport and a $25 cab ride from the seaport. Two stories. No elevators. No porters. So had to carry my three heavy bags up stairs myself. The "renovated" room looked like it had been renovated with used appliances, cabinets, furniture from the 1980s. The bed was hard. The pillows were flat. The front desk was understaffed. The only person there was on the phone for 20 minutes giving a caller directions...After giving me my key card, he just pointed me toward the door, still on the phone. The only good thing about the room were the linens, which were clean. There was no vending area and no on-site restaurant. A Tony Roma's is a few hundred yards away. Next time, I'll know better.

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: jimmyb01
Reviews.Content: This property seems to be quite modern, it is in a very safe location near some good shops and restaurants. Nice pool and plenty of chairs and sunbeds. The whole place looks new so I can't see there being any problems with rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: Eric-A95
Reviews.Content: First, we were bumped across Miami from one Homestead property to another, which added an hour of driving. Then, after arriving at this place, my fiancee went to the bathroom and almost threw up. The room looked as though it had just been cleaned -- the beds were made, and the bathroom was relatively fresh -- except for the toilet. It seemed as though a staffer had cleaned and then gone to the bathroom -- wrong order! Yes, he or she had flushed after going #2, but fecal matter was stuck to the toilet. There were also many hairs all over the bathroom. This was simply unacceptable. The in-room kitchen was old and unrenovated. If you need to live in a motel, this might be a good deal, but as travelers, we did not enjoy this. Unfortunately, after driving all over Miami, we were too tired to move again. Once we checked the beds and found them clean, we decided to brave it until morning. All told, it was a decent value, but you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Nice area clean and close to airport”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was close to the airport ,clean and I spent only $35. for the room in a decent area was happy with it I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay ever!!!! Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on priceline and called the hotel to make sure that we would be able to accomodate 3 people in our room. The woman at the desk told us that she would note our reservation for a rollaway. We arrived after many airline delays at 1 a.m. and on arrival the man at the desk told us that he didn't have any rollaways and that my 15 year old could sleep on the couch. We get up to the room and there is no couch! So we call the desk and ask once again where our daughter is supposed to sleep. The man states that suddenly he has a rollaway but no mattress for it and he'll call us back. He calls us back and says he has the rollaway and that he would be right over with it. He showed up about 20 minutes later with the rollaway and some sheets. No pillow, no blankets. He went on to tell me that since this was a "priceline" room that I couldn't expect my daughter to have anywhere to sleep. The next morning my husband spoke with the General Manager who again commented on it being a "priceline" room and offered a free one night stay coupon. Meanwhile we had a leak on the floor in the kitchen which caused the floor to be wet and slippery and bugs (hundreds of small ants and tiny bugs) on the counters. The chairs, counters and floor were sticky. The final straw came when it was discovered that the towels in the bathroom had been used - full of black hair and stained. We would never even consider staying here again and suggest that you don't either.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: DingSLU
Reviews.Content: My partner and I, after months of planning our first ever vacation, decided to stay to the Miami Airport Homestead Suites. We were greeted pleasantly by the hotel. We spent a total of 2 weeks there and had a blast. We did have 2 negative experiences though. FIRST - The hotel apparently has a policy for extended stays; they give you 1 full clean a week and 1 refresh. After coming to terms with that not so pleasing policy we decided to stay on. To our dismay, our rooms, after a full 8 days, had NOT even received ONE cleaning. After complaining to the front desk with no response, we finally resorted to the Manager and our room was immediately placed in order. SECOND - we had a situation with our credit card - and the hotel's way of dealing with the situation was to lock our room in our absence. Whilst I was shopping, my partner came back to find the key to the room not functioning. They refused to let him into the room to get the cash which we had stored there. They claimed that he was not on the guest list - DUHHH the room WAS booked for 2 and 2 persons showed up at checkin. Be sure to include all roomers on the guest list. After that, we got every request we had (that is after putting the manager in his place). There was ONE really nice lady at the front desk who usually worked the late shift. YOU can stay there! it's pretty close to shopping and the airport but you'll need a rental (depots are close to the hotel too). Great time in Miami.

HotelInfo.Name: Homestead Miami Airport / Doral
HotelInfo.Address: 8720 N.W. 33rd Street, Miami, FL 33172
